title: PHPandKeyword

metadata.description: Learn about PHPandKeyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Return
true
if both statements are true:
<?php
if (5 > 3 and 5 < 10) {
echo "true";
} else {
echo 
  "false";
}
?>

Definition and Usage
The
and
keyword is a logical operator.
Logical operators are used to combine conditional statements.
The return value will only be
true
if both statements return
true
, otherwise it will return
false
.
Tip:
The difference between
and
and
&&
is that
and
has very low precedence, meaning that
most other operations get evaluated first.
Related Pages
Read more about operators in our
PHP Operators Tutorial
.

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers PHPandKeyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPandKeyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPandKeyword and how to apply it in your projects.
